TD Bank to grow in Mass.

TD Bank Group, already one of the biggest banks on the East Coast, plans to expand, the bank’s top executive said Thursday in Boston. (Boston Globe, 2:04 p.m.)
  • 04/17/12 TD Bank adds new VP  |  More Business

Tribe plans $500m Taunton casino

The Mashpee Wampanoag casino would include a water park, three hotels, and high-end retail shops, according to details the tribe revealed today. (Globe, 2:38 p.m.)
  • Proposed Mass. casino sites  |  More

Hollywood celebrities spotted in Boston

Designer and reality starlet Nicole Richie celebrated the grand opening of National Jean Company in Boston with a fashion show of her spring collection yesterday.

Liberty Mutual says profits up 26%

The company reported it earned $459 million in the first quarter, having benefited from the mild winter and increased prices for insurance policies. (Globe, 12:09 p.m.)
  • Deval Patrick says Liberty Mutual pay 'breaktaking'

Effort aims to draw people to waterfront

Several nonprofits have teamed with local shops and
food merchants for the "Summer on the Waterfront: Eat, Splash, Shop, Learn" campaign launching June 1. (Globe)

Search for Gloucester girl on last day

Off the coast of Rockport an extra session of divers was added to the effort to find a missing toddler on the last day of planned searches. (Boston Globe, 2:26 p.m.)

Mass. House passes $32.4b budget

A spending plan for fiscal 2013 was approved in a midnight 150-4 vote, and followed a reportedly sharp debate over EBT program changes. (Globe, 11:32 a.m.)

Concord bans water
in plastic bottles

The vote brings the town a step closer to becoming the first municipality in the nation to enact a complete prohibition on sales.

A sudden end to season for the champion Bruins

The Spoked-Bs were sent home Wednesday night, losing Game 7 of their first-round series to the upstart Washington Capitals in front of a stunned crowd at TD Garden.

Former BC trustee quits boards of 3 more Jesuit schools

The Rev. Bradley M. Schaeffer resigned after the Globe reported that he failed to stop a former priest from sexually abusing boys.

Cut health bills for all

Ronn Garry Jr., an owner of an independent Roxbury market, believes in the state's health care reform law. But the law Garry supports is kicking his behind.

Victoria Kennedy

A national religious group called on the Worcester bishop to allow the senator's widow to deliver the commencement address at Anna Maria College.

A tiny band of neighborhood activists is vowing to fight what now feels like destiny: a gambling mecca in East Boston.

Nigeria: 6 killed in newspaper
office bombings

Four Nigerian newspapers – including a major paper in country's capital – were attacked by bombers, killing at least six. The attacks mirror others by a radical Islamist in the country.

Politics

Former rival Rick Perry
endorses Mitt Romney

Perry endorsed Romney after previously having criticized his business record, calling him a “vulture capitalist,” and allied with Newt Gingrich when he left the GOP race in January.
